Author: Audo#5667
Content:
This is a temporary channel to get feedback from our community. We got new community guidelines and we are defining a good moderation policy that makes everyone happy.

We are also thinking if there's any way to reduce the amount of channels. Probably not :abusedsmily: 

Drop your feedback & ideas here

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: I agree with the move to raise the general quality of what gets posted on this discord. It also seems like an inordinate amount of posts are just people complaining. Constructive criticism ie "I think X is a little weak, we should try Y to make X better" is a lot better than "kmd is a total shitcoin and your team sucks". People often just come in here to troll everyone and there should be some threshold where people who are being dicks will be muted or kicked, even temporarily. No one needs it. It just lowers morale. This is an open project, but that doesn't mean that anyone should be able to come here and spread their psychic waste because they're frustrated.

A graphic representation would set the ball rolling and komodo would be in the minds of devs and investors.

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: Ecosystem needs a #mediation channel to help prevent flame wars. Quarantine the posts and the ones arguing to only this channel till disputes solved, utilize a mediator. Find some common ground, shake hands, act like adults.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
when I used to run a chat back in the GPRS WAP days we had a room called "Prison" people who got sent to prison could not come out until they "did their time" but in the prison, they could rant without rules, and only "inmates" were allowed in that room. 
It worked really well, but I don't know if this is possible on Discord unless you manually assign a "prisoner" role to said people and then manually remove it.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: we had it coded, maybe a discord bot can manage this the same way, so after X minutes it removes the role, and the role would make the person only able to see / write in that single room

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: In my part of the world saying wtf is not ban worthy. It's more of a colloquial expression. Calling some one mean names such as @#$&, or a string of demeaning curse words is however ban worthy.

Author: joe2x4#5987

Author: Audo#5667
Content:
The decision was made after reading the message history. We won't be banning people too easily in general, but there have been a number of people who have caused problems and we take a more strict line now to set a proper moderation standard.

Many people work hard to build up this project, and we don't need people here who never contribute to the conversation but only cause problems.

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: Agree. I appreciate the case by case common sense approach and explanation of actions taken.

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: Hopefully though, a cool down time out ban is also implemented as sanity is often governed by external forces and most times rest and food are the cure.

Content: True.
